results.title: Children's songs of Japan
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Sotoji Kimura
results.brief_description: Children are much the same the whole world over - but the songs sung by the children of Japan are traditional and distinctive. Many are associated with the seasons and historical events while others are the simple type of songs associated with childhood adventures and fairy tale characters, but all have a truly Japanese character.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Sotoji Kimura

results.title: Children's song games = Comptines
results.brief_description: Springtime means being outside. It means being able to play hopscotch, and sing songs, and play with bolo-bats. This film is about little girls celebrating spring in Montreal. They play in alley-ways, in doorways, in parks, and on the street. They sing songs that were sung by their parents and maybe their grandparents. Gibberish rhymes, counting songs, and old folk songs ring out in children’s voices. Without commentary, this short sketch travels the by-ways of Montreal where little girls play. Comptines is a French word for children’s song games.

results.title: Children's play centres
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and National Fitness Council of Victoria
results.brief_description: During the Christmas holidays many Melbourne children are entertained and cared for at play centres, established by local authorities in association with the National Fitness Council. Short sequences show the youngsters taking part in various games under the guidance of trained leaders.

results.title: Children's play
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Play is a dynamic factor in a child’s development as well as a requirement for good health. This film points out the changing form of children’s recreations, portraying play at each age level. The film demonstrates the important contributions parents can and should make to give their children the best possible chance for healthy play.

results.title: Children's language in early reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Samples some of the early reading activities in two primary schools in Britain. These activities include use of word cards, sentence construction and reading of printed texts and children’s own stories.

results.title: Children's fantasies
results.brief_description: To children all fantasies, useful or destructive, are very real. This film explains some of the causes of children’s fantasies and shows how they may affect a child’s development. It discusses such common problems as fear of the dark, imaginary friends, and the interpretation of Santa Claus. Suggests ways of making fantasies an impetus to creative living rather than an escape from reality.

results.title: Children's emotions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child development series”.
Correlated with the book “Child development” by Elizabeth B. Hurlock, Ph. D., this film discusses the major emotions of childhood; curiosity, fear, anger, jealousy and joy. Children’s emotions are intense, frequent, but of short duration, and result in a number of behaviour responses.

results.title: Children's circle
results.brief_description: A quality series that brings outstanding children’s books to the screen. The stories bring alive the actual illustrations from the book, through animation and iconographic techniques. Honoured by awards at Film Festivals worldwide, these programs are the perfect bridge between video and reading.
